title: Adrian Flynn
text:
Adrian Flynn () is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. He played at club level for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 1036</a>), the <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage № 720</a>), the <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a>, the <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage № 830</a>) and the <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley Bulldogs</a>, as a , i.e. number 2 or 5.
Playing career.
Club career.
Adrian Flynn made his début for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> in October 1992 and played his last match for there during the <a href="1994%E2%80%9395%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1994–95 season</a>. He was transferred to the <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> on 25 July 1995 and from Castleford to the <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a>. He was transferred from Dewsbury to the <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>, making his début there on Sunday 19 January 2003, and played his last match for them during the 2003 season.
Genealogical information.
Adrian Flynn is the older brother of the rugby league footballer, <a href="Wayne%20Flynn">Wayne Flynn</a>.
